content.description: A pretty little route with great rock and a misleading name.  Although it's on the Warm-up Wall, I didn't find it to be a great warm up due to the short lived crux, gentle angle, and easy finish.  It's also much easier than some of the other 11's like Brutus, or Bloody Mary.Start to the left of the arete on some nice pockets and move up and right past the crux to establish on the main face(might want to stick clip the first bolt).  Work your feet and stand up for some very cool pockets and a welcome second bolt.  The difficulty eases past this point to 5.10b and the rock is a pure joy, however there is a bit of air between the last two bolts.  Don't be spooked, just enjoy the sculpted flutes and pinches and keep reminding yourself that it gets easier the higher you climb.
content.location: Right side of the large cave at the Warm-Up Wall.  Second route from the right.

content.description: Starts out slabby, then steeper to hueco pockets. Crux is using a few crimpers to the chains. A fun route.
content.location: First route at the right end of the wall.

content.description: Some fun and straightforward moves for the first couple of clips give way to sharp side-pulls and an uninspiring slab.  Not an awesome warm-up.
content.location: Left end of the Warm-up Wall

content.description: While this is one of the easiest routes at VRG it doesn't make for as good of a warmup as some of the harder climbs.  An easy start on lower angle rock leads to a tricky crux around the second bolt.  The holds are hard to find and nothing is great.  After the crux head up on easier but still thought provoking ground to a large ledge and the anchors.
content.location: Second route from the left side of the Warm Up Wall.

content.description: The fun route makes for a great warmup.  Awesome holds and cool moves remind you why limestone is so much fun.  Start on easy ground up to the high first bolt on mostly good holds.  From here enter the the overhanging groove passing interesting holds and fun moves to the top of the wall.  No standout crux but not too many easy moves either.
content.location: In the Middle of the Wall.  Third route from both the left and right side of the wall.

content.description: With a hand full of moderate routes, this wall makes a good first stop before heading to the harder climbs beyond.
